intro: Silene baldwinii, commonly known as the Baldwin's campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink to purple flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in arid environments. It is often found in regions with high elevation, such as mountainous areas. Silene baldwinii is considered a rare species and is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to harsh climates.
